bibl.title: Leonard Martin v. Washington Territory. Application for Writ of Habeas Corpus
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p: IN THE DISTRICT COURT OF THE THIRD JUDICIAL DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON TERRITORY, HOLDING TERMS FOR SEATTLE AND CIRCUIT ETC.

UNITED STATED OF AMERICA VS. LEONARD MARTIN.
SELLING WHISKEY TO INDIANS CONTRARY TO LAW.
APPICATION FOR HABEAS CORPUS ETC.
TO THE HONORABLE ROGER S. GREENE JUDGE OF THE ABOVE ENTITLED COURT: -

YOUR HUMBLE PETITIONER THE DEFENDANT HEREIN ABOVE SET FORTH LEONARD MARTIN, REPRESENTS TO YOUR HONOR THAT HE IS ILLEGALLY DETAINED IN THE JAIL BUILDING IN KING COUNTY IN SAID CITY OF SEATTLE AND UNLAWFULLY DEPRIVED OF HIS LIBERTY IN THIS TO WRIT: -
1. THAT HE IS RESTRAINED BY ONE JOHN H. MACGRAW JAILER OF SAID COUNTY OF KING AND SHERIFF OF SAID COUNTY, IN SAID CITY OS SEATTLE IN THE COUNTY OF KING AND TERROTPR AFORESAID.

2. THAT THE CAUSE OR PRETENSE OF HIS RESTRAINT SO UNLAWFULLY IS A CHARGE B OR INTENDED COMPLAINT FROM ONE JAMES G. SWAN, A UNITED STATES COMMISSIONER, CHARGING OR PURPORTING TO CHANGE THE SAID DEFENDANT WITH THE OFENSE OF SELLING WHISKEY TO INDIANS CONTRARY TO LAW; THAT THIS REASON FROM HIS DETENTION IS ACCORDING TO THE BEST OF HIS KNOWLEDGE.

3. THAT THE ILLEGALITY OF THE RESTRAINT CONSISTS IN THIS TO WIT, - THAT THE SAID COMPLAINT PURPORTING TO BE THE FOUNDATION UPON WHICH HE IS HELD IS NOT SUFFICIENT IN LAW TO SUSTAIN THE CHARGE IN TECHNIQUE OR IN MATTER OF FACT, THAT THE COMPLAINT SHOWS NO OFFENSE COMMITTED ON
ON ITS FACE, FOR WHICH THIS DEFENDANT AND APPLICANT SHOULD BE DERIVED OF HIS CXXX NOR DOES THE SAME CHARGE ANY OFFNSE AT ALL.

WHEREFORE THE SAID APPLICANT HEREIN PRAYS THE HONORABLE COURT XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX THAT A WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS ISSUE BRINGING THIS SAID PETITIONER BEFORE YOUR HONOR THAT YOUR HONOR MAY ENQUIRE IN TO MEANS WHEREBY THE SAID PETITIONER IS SO UNLAWFULLY DETAINED AND THAT THE SAID PETITIONER BE DISCHARGED FROM XXX CUSTODY OF THE SAID J.H. MCGRAY SHERIFF AS AFORESAID.
Martin Leonard
by & on his behalf by James H. Lewis his Ally
TERRITORY OF WASHINGTON COUNTY OF KING S.S.
IN THE MATTER OF THE UNITED STATES VS. LEONARD MARTIN. HABEAS CORPUS.

PERSONALLY APPCARED BEFORE ME A NOTARY PUBLIC JAMES H. LEWIS WHO BEING FIRST DULY SWORN, ON HIS OATH DEPOSES AND SAYS, THAT HE HAS READ AND KNOWS THE CONTENTS OF THE FOREGOING APPLICATION FOR HABEAS CORPUS, THE THAT THE APPLICATION IS MADE BY HIMIN THE BEHALF OF THE SAID APPLICANT LEONARD MARTI; AND THAT HE BELIVES THE FACTS STATED IN THE SAID PETITION ARE TRUE AND SO STATE.
SWORN TO AND SUBSRIBES BEFORE ME THIS 20TH. DAY OF MAY A.D. 1885
Wm D. Hood Notary Public in for Washignton Terrtory
IN THE of of Washington Territory holding terms oat jesule
uja vs Leonard martin} selling whis key & Indians No 4432
Appication for writ of Habeas Corpus
FILED MAY 20 1885 James Seavey, Clerk By James P Laudlow Deputy Clerk,
Jas H Lewis for
